intro: Arabis reichenbachii, commonly known as the alpine rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. Arabis reichenbachii is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
